alert.note: Alert for Western Highland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 06 at 3:28PM EST until January 07 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 3 PM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches, with isolated totals up to 12 inches. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 15 below zero along the ridge tops. * WHERE...In Virginia, Western Highland County. In West Virginia, Western Grant and Western Pendleton Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 3 AM EST Friday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 3 AM to 3 PM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow is expected this evening when when snowfall rates of 1-2 inches per hour are possible. Visibility will be reduced to near or less than one-quarter mile during the heaviest snow.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
